Ernest Hemingway

Adventurer

Life Story:

  • 1899-born in Oak Park, Illinois, a suburb of Chicago.
  • 1913-1917-attended Oak Park and River Forest High School. He took part in a number of sports such as boxing, track and field, water polo, and football. He excelled in English classes, and with his sister Marcelline, performed in the school orchestra for two years.
  • 1918-responded to a Red Cross recruitment effort in Kansas City and signed on to become an ambulance driver in Italy
  • 1933-Hemingway and Pauline went on safari to East Africa. The 10-week trip provided material for Green Hills of Africa, as well as for the short stories "The Snows of Kilimanjaro" and "The Short Happy Life of Francis Macomber".
  • 1939-crossed to Cuba in his boat to live in the Hotel Ambos Mundos in Havana.
  • 1961-suicided

    • Read more about him on: Wikipedia
